content:
I've opened https://github.com/rust-lang/lang-team/issues/18 to discuss a possible design meeting topic around const evaluation. This is using the template for meeting proposals that I added, and I think this is the process we should be using to evaluate and discuss what to discuss. =)

I'm somewhat curious whether folks think Zulip or Github would be better: I've started to re-evaluate my push to move things like this to Zulip, but I'm open to feedback. If we do want to have it on Zulip, I should badger @simulacrum to connect the compiler-team machinery to create topics automatically (and we should make a dedicated #t-lang/meetings stream).
Also I saw a number of problems with the template as written =)
Should be as easy as copying and slightly adjusting the triagebot.toml; I can take a look later I think.
I'm a big fan of having it on Zulip, and I would love to see that automation.
@simulacrum Maybe we can extract that functionnality from the prioritize command and generalize it a bit?
We already have the functionality, just needs to be configured for this repo
Oh, sorry, I thought you meant the I-prioritize shenanigans, but you are talking about MCPs, right? Sorry for the noise
